data.title: Windows Templates and Pipeline Fixes
data.body:
This PR starts to integrate the new content pipeline with the Windows VS templates.
- Fixed up the templates to appear in VS with some reasonable order. (Fixes #3191)
- Removed old .targets file and fixed up the new one.
- Removed old Content VS template project.
- Added support for new content pipeline to Windows template.
- MGCB no longer shows usage on empty content builds.
- Fixed Pipeline tool to use EXE path for loading item templates.
- Fixed build script to delete old template .zip files before rebuilding them.

data.title: Implement content pipeline tool as a server
data.body:
The idea here is that the primary content pipeline compilation is done by a Pipeline server tool; this can be run on a desktop machine for individual developers or on a central machine for teams of developers.

Various forms of content compilation (MGCB, Pipeline?) could be centralized to use a running server to perform the actual content compilation, or automatically start the server on the local machine if none can be found on the local network.

In addition, the MonoGame framework could fallback to using the server if the game doesn't have a compiled version of the content present.  This would make developing significantly easier as content wouldn't require recompilation before builds each time.

The Pipeline server could also cache content based on the settings and SHA1 of the incoming content. This would mean that teams of developers wouldn't have to rebuild the content on each of their machines; instead the various pipeline tools and framework could retrieve the results from the server.

Presumably we'd also need a command line tool that pulls built content from the server and writes it out suitable for releasing games.

data.title: Use FFmpeg for audio compilation
data.body:
This rewrites the audio compilation part of the content pipeline to use FFmpeg instead of NAudio / MonoMac's Audio Toolkit.

I've tested compilation of audio assets on Linux and sound effects playback successfully (although music is being converted to Ogg format instead of Wave, but that's a separate issue).  As I don't have access to any other platforms (only Windows in a VM with no Audio), I'll need other people to verify that the audio compilation works and results in XNB files that can be played back

I'm pretty sure the format names for FFmpeg are correct for the conversion, but I'm less sure about the muxer names (which are the wrappers around the encoded audio data).  For PCM, the muxer had to be "s16le" which means "raw PCM data"; I'm not sure whether the ADPCM or IMA ADPCM formats should be using the Wave muxer or just contain the raw data.

data.title: WinGLContext.MakeCurrent fails with error code 2004
data.body:
I'm having rather frequent errors when starting MonoGame (Windows OpenGL) projects. The stacktrace is listed below and the target machine is running Windows 8.1 pro 64bit.

The error code 2004 corresponds to ERROR_TRANSFORM_NOT_SUPPORTED (The requested transformation operation is not supported.) Another error that is thrown with the same stack trace and the same GraphicsContextException is error code 6 (ERROR_INVALID_HANDLE).

```
OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsContextException: Failed to make context 65537 current. Error: 2004
   at OpenTK.Platform.Windows.WinGLContext.MakeCurrent(IWindowInfo window)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Threading.BlockOnUIThread(Action action)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Texture2DReader.Read(ContentReader reader, Texture2D existingInstance)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentTypeReader`1.Read(ContentReader input, Object existingInstance)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.ReadObject[T]()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.ReadAsset[T]()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.ReadAsset[T](String assetName, Action`1 recordDisposableObject)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.Load[T](String assetName)
   at SilverFit.Boom.ThreadSafeContentManager.Load[T](String path)
   at SilverFit.CognitionGames.BaseContent.TextureRegion(String contentpath)
   at SilverFit.CognitionGames.CategoryContent.LoadGameSpecificContent()
   at SilverFit.CognitionGames.BaseContent.LoadAllContent()
   at SilverFit.CognitionGames.CognitionGame.LoadGameContent()
   at SilverFit.Common.Components.SilverXnaApplicationBase.LoadContent()
```

data.title: Whoops
data.body: Sorry, wrong project :D

data.title: Proposal: Protobuild packages and templates for MonoGame
data.body:
I've been working on package management functionality in Protobuild for the last month or so, and after some previous discussion, I've been developing it further to better suit MonoGame.

Protobuild's package management is designed to support both cross-platform libraries and cross-platform project templates.  For libraries, the binary packages it supports are LZMA compressed, deduplicated and can be swapped in-place for source code (and vice-versa).  For project templates, it provides an easier mechanism to start a Protobuild-based project using cross-platform libraries.

As a demonstration, [download the latest version of Protobuild](https://github.com/hach-que/Protobuild/raw/master/Protobuild.exe) into an empty directory, open a command prompt, and run:

```
Protobuild.exe --start http://protobuild.org/MonoGame/Template.2DPlatformer@develop MyNewPlatformer
```

This works on all desktop platforms (although Mac OS is untested).  For this demonstration you'll need Git in your path because there's no binary package present yet for the project template itself, and if you're running this on Mac OS or Linux, prefix the command with `mono`.  When the command completes, you should be able to open the solution in Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio and run the game.

Protobuild's package management has several advantages over using NuGet:

**Full support for cross-platform projects, in particular those that need to make native calls (such as P/Invoke)**

Protobuild designates library packages by platform; the same platforms that are used for generation, and not framework API.

**Automatic fallback to source code repositories if binary versions are not available for the platform**

Users can swap out binary packages for source versions and vice-versa transparently.  This makes it easier to diagnose issues and bugs.  To try that with the demonstration above, run:

```
Protobuild.exe --swap-to-source http://protobuild.org/MonoGame/MonoGame
Protobuild.exe --generate
```

or try the reverse:

```
Protobuild.exe --swap-to-binary http://protobuild.org/MonoGame/MonoGame
Protobuild.exe --generate
```

**Packages are LZMA compressed and deduplicated to significantly reduce their size**

For reference, the binary packages I've built are:
- Windows + Content Pipeline: 24.4Mb
- Linux + Content Pipeline: 15.7Mb
- WindowsGL: 1.5Mb

The content pipeline includes all external tools and relevant binaries (e.g. ffmpeg + ffprobe for those platforms).

**Support for module templates as packages**

As demonstrated above, this makes it very easy for people to start with MonoGame on any platform (not just Windows).  This requires no installation of MonoGame for developers to start using the engine.

(This doesn't fix some of the issues with running the Content Pipeline on other platforms, but these exist independent on the method of using MonoGame)

**Automatic package configuration**

Partly the reason that #3179 was submitted; Protobuild can automatically package the MonoGame project for any platform after it's built, with no additional configuration required.  The following commands will produce a binary package suitable for uploading:

```
Protobuild.exe --generate Windows
msbuild
Protobuild.exe --pack . package_Windows.tar.lzma Windows
```

To upload it is:

```
Protobuild.exe --push <api_key> package_Windows.tar.lzma http://protobuild.org/MonoGame/MonoGame <git_hash> Windows <optional_branch_to_update>
```
## 

More documentation on the package management feature can be found at [documentation](https://protobuild.readthedocs.org/en/latest/package_management_protobuild.html).  I have pretty much all of this work in a PR (which is not yet submitted, pending discussion on this issue), except for the package push commands which will require some build server configuration.

data.title: Pipeline tool generates shifted sprite font from texture when starting char is 'space'
data.body:
Hello there,

I've been experiencing an issue with the pipeline tool while trying to generate a sprite font from a texture. The problem is that it seems to trim the "first character" parameter and use another value than the default space character (which seems to be the 'null' character once trimmed).

As a result, the sprite font present a character shift of 32 characters. When I try to draw an upper case 'A', it draws a lower case 'a'. It seems that it uses the character index 0 ('null') instead of the default index 32 ('space') as starting character.

I tried generating the sprite font with the XNA Content Pipeline (and MonoGame sprite font processor) and the generated font is OK.
This makes me think that the problem comes from the Pipeline tool itself which trims the first character parameter (or basically anything?).

Sorry for not fixing this (probably) trivial issue myself, I'm not into Xwt and don't really where to look.

data.title: Change OpenGL resources dispose behavior
data.body:
Simplified dispose behavior for opengl resources. It shouldn't be MonoGame's responsibility to delay resource disposal (should be done by a higher level rendering component). This PR should fix #3188

Note that this PR keeps `GraphicsDevice.AddDisposeAction()` to be used by the `GraphicsDevice.PlatformDispose` method. This is on purpose since there might be some corner cases there that I didn't get a chance to test yet.

data.title: Can we sort project Templates in Visual Studio
data.body:
I installed the VS add-ins yesterday

On a Windows 8.1/VS Ultimate 2013/Windows SDK there's a couple of confusing items
1. We show Windows Phone 8 template at the top and Windows Phone 8.1 near the bottom. The 8.1 should be near the top - can we hide the 8.0 one somewhere 'previous platforms'? 
2. We show 2 Windows store templates - one with XAML one without. Should we provide guidance on what to choose - should we put one up at the top and hide the other?
3. There is no Windows phone 7 template - there's still a decent number of these if you want to cover the whole windows phone space. Did we ever have one of these?

Do any of these matter now we have universal apps? Sorry I am not too well educated on the limitations on this.

data.title: Installing dev builds in confusing for first timers
data.body:
We recommend people get dev builds since 3.2 is so far behind but its not obvious what to do - high barrier to entry is not good. 

If you start here:
http://www.monogame.net/downloads/

And click through the links the windows option opens a tree with an EXE and an mpack file - which do I choose?

The Mac one opens a closed up tree structure - several of them are full of what appears to be just files. Again not sure what to do here.

Need to provide a direct link or instructions

data.title: Sign MonoGame exe installer
data.body:
When you install the windows based installer on Windows 8 it is blocked by SmartScreen and shows 'unknown' as the author.

Most developers know what to do to get round it but its more professional to get this correctly signed.

MSDN how to sign in installer http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa368289(v=vs.85).aspx and more http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms537361(VS.85).aspx

Protection of the private keys is something that needs careful consideration though. They cannot be in the public repo and need to be accessible to as few people as possible. See https://github.com/blog/1390-secrets-in-the-code

This article says that Thawte provides free code signing certs for open source http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aS5Plr02f8Is

This is another company that offer free of open source certs http://www.certum.eu/certum/cert,offer_en_open_source_cs.xml

More information on signing here - the EV certificates are very expensive though $500-$700 a year http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ie/archive/2012/08/14/microsoft-smartscreen-amp-extended-validation-ev-code-signing-certificates.aspx

We use Digicert for guncraft - they were very reliable https://www.digicert.com/code-signing/ev-code-signing-compared.htm

data.title: Null reference to RenderTarget2D.GraphicsDevice during Dispose()
Implement SkinnedModel importers that work in MGCB
data.body:
This is a placeholder for getting skinned models to work using the Mono content builder

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2253 was an initial attempt.
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3058 added some fixes for missing bones

For now it appears that processing your models using the XNA CP is the only workaround.

Thanks

data.title: Upgrade Android to OpenTK-1
data.body:
Also added Property to Activity to control if the rendering is done on
the UI thread or not. By not rendering on the UI thread we save
a SyncContext.Send call in the underlying AndroidGameView.
This can introduce up to a 100ms delay in a Render call which
can cause a stutter.

By default we will leave RenderOnUIThread = true to maintain
backwards compatability.

The upgrade to OpenTK-1 was required as the fix for this
is not present in the OpenTK 0.9.9.3 version as it is there
for backwards compatabiltiy only.

data.title: MacOS: solution build fail
data.body:
When building MonGame on MacOS, the solution build fails with:

error CS0433: The imported type `MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioFormatType' is defined multiple times
error CS0433: The imported type`MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioFileType' is defined multiple times
error CS0433: The imported type `MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioConverterError' is defined multiple times
error CS0433: The imported type`MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioBuffers' is defined multiple times
error CS0433: The imported type `MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioStreamPacketDescription' is defined multiple times
error CS0433: The imported type`MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioConverter' is defined multiple times
error CS0433: The imported type `MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioFile' is defined multiple times
error CS0433: The imported type`MonoMac.AudioToolbox.AudioStreamBasicDescription' is defined multiple times

Without the content pipeline build, the MacOS projects will build fine.

data.title: VisualStudio Support for Pipeline GUI Tool
data.body:
This PR add the correct registry keys to the installer so that .MGCB files open in the Pipeline GUI tool by default when double clicked in the Visual Studio project tree view.

Fixes #3178.

data.title: Improved multisampling support on iOS and Android
data.body:
On Android, some extensions are not accessible using DLLImport and we need to use eglGetProcAddress instead. The NVIDIA Shield (1st Gen and Tablet) and a few other devices depending on GPU and driver version can encounter this issue.

This PR fixes the problem by using eglGetProcAddress when retrieving extensions on Android platforms. It also should behave better in case of an issue retrieving the function pointers, even if the driver claims the extension is supported.

Tested on Nexus 9, Galaxy Tab 4, Galaxy Tab 2 7.0, NVIDIA Shield (Portable), iPhone 6, iPad Mini

data.title: Replace NAudio with FFMPEG
data.body:
This was suggested to me by @hach-que.

We currently use NAudio to do audio format conversions in the pipeline.  The problem with this library is that it only works on Windows.

Since we did that work a couple of years ago we've added some support for shelling out to FFMPEG to do conversions for some platforms including PS4.

So the questions is if we should just switch over to using FFMPEG for all our audio conversion work on Windows, Mac, and Linux?

Thoughts?  @prollin @dellis1972 @KonajuGames

data.title: SoundEffects Distort or Don't Play After a While
data.body:
After a certain number of SoundEffects are played, all subsequent SoundEffects are distorted or don't play at all. Here's a link to the original topic: http://community.monogame.net/t/soundeffects-distort-or-dont-play-after-a-while/1459

I'm making a Defense game for the Windows Store in which you kill lots of enemies, and each time an enemy dies it plays a sound. It's not a problem at first, but once the player gets to around Level 38 in a single playthrough the sounds will distort or sometimes stop altogether. I'm playing sounds using SoundEffect.Play() and music with SoundEffectInstance. SoundEffect.Play() is always returning true, so there aren't too many instances being played at once.

An easy way to replicate this issue is to play the same sound 10 times in Update() for around 8-10 seconds. Then, any subsequent sounds will distort or simply not play.

There was a reported memory leak issue for SoundEffects here: http://community.monogame.net/t/soundeffect-loaded-via-contentmanager-causing-memory-leak-after-resume/1174

Unfortunately it seems that the fix is not in place for the current build, and I suspect that either memory leak or failure to properly clean up SoundEffects after they finish playing is the cause of my problem. When the problem occurs and I check Task Manager, the game takes up roughly 30% of my CPU as opposed to 1-2% when the game starts.

EDIT: Based on the comments below, it seems this is an actual issue with MonoGame as this problem doesn't seem to occur with XNA.

data.title: Migrate Lidgren.Network to Protobuild
data.body:
This change migrates Lidgren.Network to Protobuild, which is the last C# project remaining.

Tested on Linux and could build Linux, Windows and WindowsGL platforms.  I guess we'll find out if the other platforms still build once the build server runs (I don't expect too many issues as Lidgren only has one platform-specific file, and all the references are trivial).

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] MGCB can't be found when opening tool from Visual Studio
data.body:
I added my .mgcb file to my solution file and set it to open with the pipeline tool when double-clicked. Actions fail with "Build failed:  MGCB.exe is not in the search path!"

I assume this is because its looking for MGCB relative to the current directory which is likely different when opening from Visual Studio.

data.title: Ensure MonoGame builds successfully on Linux
data.body:
On Linux, MonoGame doesn't currently build successfully because the app.config file has different capitalization on disk than it does in the definition file.  

Without this change, you get:

```
/usr/lib/mono/4.5/Microsoft.Common.targets: error : Cannot copy /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/MonoGame/Tools/Pipeline/app.config to /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/MonoGame/Tools/Pipeline/bin/Linux/AnyCPU/Debug/Pipeline.exe.config, as the source file doesn't exist.
```

(because it's actually `App.config` on disk)

data.title: Correct links in project definitions for new Protobuild documentation
data.body: Missed these links during the last PR.  This updates the project definitions so the FAQ on project GUIDs points to the right place.

data.title: Update README to point to new Protobuild documentation
data.body:
I've been moving the documentation for Protobuild over to Read the Docs.  The new documentation can be found at https://protobuild.readthedocs.org/.

This updates the MonoGame README file to point to the new URL (eventually I'll be turning off the Protobuild GitHub wiki altogether).

data.title: Texture2D.FromStream on Android locks the app if called from background thread
data.body:
The issue was brought up here:

http://community.monogame.net/t/texture2d-fromstream-issue/334/5

This works fine on XNA PC, and I believe on MonoGame W8 (RT), and may be implemented on iOS, but I'm not sure.

data.title: Add support for framebuffer multisampling on Tegra devices
data.body: Add support for framebuffer multisampling on Tegra devices (Nexus 7 2012, Nexus 9, Shield, Ouya)

data.title: TouchCollection Not Clearing
data.body:
When I tap on the screen with a few fingers and simultaneously click with a mouse, a TouchLocation with the Moved status gets stuck in the TouchCollection and is never cleared out. All subsequent touches are still registered, but index 0 of the TouchCollection continues to return that same TouchLocation with the Moved status, and the time it was registered remains the same.

This was originally reported at the following URL: http://community.monogame.net/t/touchcollection-not-clearing/1425

A test project can be downloaded from the following URL: http://www.mediafire.com/download/lljjv28fi1fo77a/TouchCollection_TestProject.zip

Simply open up the project and run it. Whenever you tap, you will hear a sound. If you swipe, you will hear a different sound.

Reproduction Steps:

Tap and swipe on the screen like a madman with one hand while clicking on the screen using a mouse on the other hand. After a while, you should stop hearing the touch sounds. This means that you have successfully reproduced the issue. Some debug information is displayed in the Output window of Visual Studio.

data.title: Add Support for Visual Studio 2013 Community Edition
data.body:
Visual Studio 2013 Community Edition currently does not support the following project types:
- {6D335F3A-9D43-41b4-9D22-F6F17C4BE596}    MonoGame Content Project
- {C089C8C0-30E0-4E22-80C0-CE093F111A43}    MonoGame Windows Phone 8 Project
- {EFBA0AD7-5A72-4C68-AF49-83D382785DCF}    MonoGame Android Project
- {76F1466A-8B6D-4E39-A767-685A06062A39}    MonoGame Windows Phone 8.1 Project

Creating a new solution using a project template results in an error dialog with the following contents:

```
---------------------------
Microsoft Visual Studio
---------------------------
A problem was encountered creating the sub project 'Game1'.  The project file 'C:\Users\...\AppData\Local\Temp\tri4djb5.r3s\Temp\Game1.csproj' cannot be opened.

There is a missing project subtype.
Subtype: '{6D335F3A-9D43-41b4-9D22-F6F17C4BE596}' is unsupported by this installation.
---------------------------
OK   
---------------------------
```

data.title: Improving ManagedPVRTC
data.body:
I just submited a [PR to the ManagedPVRTC source repository](https://github.com/SickheadGames/ManagedPVRTC/pull/2) and want to make sure it gets enough attention.

ManagedPVRTC is a simple wrapper around the PVRTexLib from Imagination that allows the MonoGame Content Pipeline to compress textures to PVRTC (for iOS). 
PVRTexLib actually supports many formats (including DXT and ETC1) and could be used for scaling textures and/or transcoding from any supported formats (even the non compressed ones).

The submitted PR is a first step in that direction. It most likely need to be improved, built on Linux and MacOSX and added to the MonoGame Dependencies repo.
